Package com.android

Class FoodFactory

java.lang.Object
com.android.FoodFactory
public class FoodFactory
extends Object
this is a class that contains method that will return a different type of Food dependant on the type of Animal that needs to be feed, i.e Meat object for Lion, Fish for PolarBear we have three overloaded getFood() methods one takes a String one takes a Animal object One takes a Animaltype enum value To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial
Author:
NoelF

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    FoodFactory()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Food getFood​(Animal myAnimal)
    this method uses the Animal type object to determine what food is produced, this is a more enclosed systemt as this will limit you to the classes of Animal you have in the application (we have a Zebra, Lion, Goat,Rabbit,PolarBear classes and all of these are sub classes of Animal, so we can only use these types).
    static Food getFood​(AnimalType type)
    this method uses an enum called AnimalType to determine what Food is produced.
    static Food getFood​(String animalName)
    each one of these static methods return a food object, what type of food is dependant on what Animal is sent to this method, this is determined here at runtime via a case statement this method takes a String, depending on the string this will return one of these objects Hay, of two different quantities Vegetable Fish Meat this uses a String to determine what food object should be created

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • FoodFactory

      public FoodFactory()

  • Method Details

    • getFood

      public static Food getFood​(String animalName)
      each one of these static methods return a food object, what type of food is dependant on what Animal is sent to this method, this is determined here at runtime via a case statement this method takes a String, depending on the string this will return one of these objects Hay, of two different quantities Vegetable Fish Meat this uses a String to determine what food object should be created

    • getFood

      public static Food getFood​(Animal myAnimal)
      this method uses the Animal type object to determine what food is produced, this is a more enclosed systemt as this will limit you to the classes of Animal you have in the application (we have a Zebra, Lion, Goat,Rabbit,PolarBear classes and all of these are sub classes of Animal, so we can only use these types). again this will return a Food object based on the type of Animal sent to this method

    • getFood

      public static Food getFood​(AnimalType type)
      this method uses an enum called AnimalType to determine what Food is produced. The advantage of this method is that this is totally enclosed system and it can be nothing else bar these five Animal types again this produces a Food object that is dependant on the type of Animal sent to it
